alert.note: Alert for Boone; De Kalb; Kane; McHenry; Ogle; Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 11:38PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Ogle, northern De Kalb, southeastern Winnebago, northern Kane, McHenry and Boone Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1137 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rockford to near Kirkland to Malta. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rockford, Elgin, DeKalb, Crystal Lake, Carpentersville, Algonquin, Lake in the Hills, McHenry, Belvidere, Woodstock, Huntley, Loves Park, Sycamore, Fox Lake, Harvard, Island Lake, Marengo, Poplar Grove, Genoa and Rockford Airport. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 110 and 123. I-88 between mile markers 83 and 89. I-90 between mile markers 11 and 55. This includes... Northern Illinois University, Boone County Fairgrounds, Mchenry County College, Mchenry County Fairgrounds, Moraine Hills State Park, Rock Valley College, and Rockford Rivets Baseball. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; De Kalb; Kane; McHenry; Ogle; Winnebago
